greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: T(i,j) = bits of binary expansion of i interleaved with that of j.
comment: Inverse of sequence A054239 considered as a permutation of the nonnegative integers.
Permutation of nonnegative integers. Can be used as natural alternate number casting for pairs/tables (vs. usual diagonalization).
Table T(n,k), read by antidiagonals, defined by T(n,k) = A000695(k) + 2*A000695(n). - _Philippe Deléham_, Oct 18 2011
This array is a Z-order curve in an N x N grid. - _Max Barrentine_, Sep 24 2015

Each row n of this array is the lexicographically earliest sequence such that no term occurs in a previous row, no three terms form an arithmetic progression, and the k-th term in the n-th row is equal to the k-th term in row 0 plus some constant (specifically, T(n,k)=T(0,k)+A062880(n)). - _Max Barrentine_, Jul 20 2016
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
example: The array starts in row n=0 with columns k>=0 as follows:
maple: N:= 4: # to get the first 2^(2N+1)+2^N terms
mathematica: Table[Total@ Map[FromDigits[#, 2] &, Insert[#, 0, {-1, -1}] &@ Map[Riffle[IntegerDigits[#, 2], 0, 2] &, {n - k, k}]], {n, 0, 11}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Jul 21 2016 *)
xref: See also A163357 and A163334 for other fractal curves in N x N grids.
results.author: _Marc LeBrun_, Feb 07 2000
